dataset_metadata.title: Trump Administration Event Chronology (2017-2025)
dataset_metadata.description: A curated dataset of 20 significant executive, legislative, and diplomatic events spanning the 45th and 47th Presidencies.

title: Executive Order 13769 (The 'Travel Ban')
description: An executive order suspending entry for citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries and halting the refugee program. Implemented without standard interagency review.
impact_analysis: Triggered immediate chaos at international airports and mass protests. Initiated a protracted legal battle that defined the administration's adversarial relationship with the federal judiciary.

title: Signing of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act
description: President Trump signs the most sweeping tax reform since 1986, lowering the corporate tax rate to 21% and altering individual income tax brackets.
impact_analysis: Fueled a short-term stock market boom and corporate buybacks but significantly increased the federal deficit. solidified the Republican donor class's support for the administration.

title: Imposition of Section 232 Steel/Aluminum Tariffs
description: Using national security justifications, the administration imposes global tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminum.
impact_analysis: Alienated key allies like Canada and the EU, leading to retaliatory tariffs. Established the precedent that the executive branch could unilaterally tax imports under the guise of security.

title: Announcement of 'Zero Tolerance' Immigration Policy
description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions announces a policy to criminally prosecute all illegal border crossers, necessitating the separation of children from parents.
impact_analysis: Resulted in a humanitarian crisis with thousands of family separations. The lack of tracking infrastructure made reunification difficult, drawing global condemnation.

title: Opening of U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem
description: The U.S. formally relocates its embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, recognizing the city as Israel's capital.
impact_analysis: Cemented the U.S.-Israel alliance under the Netanyahu government and pleased the Evangelical base, while severing diplomatic ties with the Palestinian leadership.

title: Singapore Summit (Trump-Kim Meeting)
description: Historic first meeting between a sitting U.S. President and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
impact_analysis: Legitimized the Kim regime on the global stage. Trump unilaterally suspended military exercises with South Korea, marking a shift toward personalistic diplomacy over alliance management.

title: Release of the Redacted Mueller Report
description: The DOJ releases the Special Counsel's report on Russian interference. It finds no criminal conspiracy but outlines episodes of obstruction.
impact_analysis: The administration's successful 'spin' of the report as exoneration demonstrated its mastery of media narratives and the politicization of the Justice Department.

title: First Impeachment of Donald Trump
description: The House votes to impeach the President for Abuse of Power regarding the withholding of Ukraine aid.
impact_analysis: Formalized the partisan rupture in Washington. The subsequent acquittal emboldened the President's view of unlimited executive authority in foreign affairs.

title: Drone Strike Killing Qasem Soleimani
description: A U.S. targeted strike kills the Iranian Quds Force commander in Baghdad.
impact_analysis: Demonstrated a high risk tolerance for military escalation. Brought the U.S. and Iran to the brink of open war, redefining the rules of engagement in the Middle East proxy conflict.

title: COVID-19 National Emergency Declaration
description: President Trump declares a National Emergency under the Stafford Act, unlocking federal funds for the pandemic response.
impact_analysis: Marked the administration's forced pivot from denial to crisis management. Initiated a period of massive federal spending and conflict with state governors over lockdowns.

title: Lafayette Square Clearing / Bible Photo Op
description: Federal forces forcibly clear peaceful protesters from Lafayette Square to allow the President to visit St. John's Church.
impact_analysis: Symbolized the administration's 'Law and Order' response to civil unrest. Sparked a rift with military leadership over the politicization of the armed forces.

title: Second Impeachment of Donald Trump
description: The House impeaches the President for 'Incitement of Insurrection' following the January 6 Capitol attack.
impact_analysis: Made Trump the first president in history to be impeached twice. Solidified his temporary isolation but set the stage for his 'revenge' narrative in the 2024 campaign.

title: Launch of Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
description: On his first day back in office, President Trump launches DOGE to dismantle federal bureaucracy, overseen by Elon Musk.
impact_analysis: Operationalized the 'deconstruction of the administrative state.' Facilitated mass firings of civil servants via Schedule F, politicizing the federal workforce.

title: EO 14151: Ending DEI Programs
description: An Executive Order banning Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion programs across the federal government and contractors.
impact_analysis: Marked the aggressive use of federal power to fight the 'Culture War.' Forced widespread institutional changes in federal agencies and private contractors dependent on federal funds.

title: Announcement of 'Liberation Day' Universal Tariffs
description: The administration announces a universal 10% baseline tariff on all imports and a system of reciprocal tariffs.
impact_analysis: Represented a shift to full autarky and protectionism. Disrupted global markets and forced a renegotiation of all U.S. trade relationships.

title: Proclamation 10948 (Harvard University)
description: A proclamation addressing 'national security risks' at Harvard University.
impact_analysis: Signaled the administration's intent to target elite higher education institutions as political adversaries, utilizing national security as the legal mechanism.

title: U.S.-China Trade Deal (Busan Agreement)
description: A trade agreement reached in Busan where China agrees to halt fentanyl precursors in exchange for U.S. tariff relief.
impact_analysis: Demonstrated the administration's strategy of linking trade wars to domestic social crises (opioids). Provided a temporary de-escalation of the 2025 trade conflict.

title: Proposal to Rescind 'Public Charge' Rule
description: DHS proposes a new rule to deny green cards to immigrants who might use any public benefits.
impact_analysis: Reinstated the wealth test for legal immigration, shifting the demographic profile of eligible immigrants away from the working poor.

title: Peace Plan Discussion with UK PM
description: President Trump discusses a U.S. peace plan for Ukraine with UK Prime Minister Starmer, referencing Geneva talks.
impact_analysis: Indicates the administration's active push for a negotiated settlement in Ukraine, likely involving concessions, consistent with an 'America First' retreat from foreign entanglements.
